result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Marie Aylward

records.addlTxt: Victim's Petition for Bond Modification, filed by victim. olg    Per SJN on 10/12/2022 - matter set for hearing.

to reschedule STC, filed by T. Hovde Legal Secretary PD Office.  Per SJN on 10/10/22: Remove the hearing. Not necessary as attorney has been appointed. Other dates already set. JA advised attys and left voicemail for DE. bph
filed by PD's Office, appointing Atty Larimore. bph

10:40 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Melissa Marie Aylward in court, in custody. Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Melissa Marie Aylward for today. Court reviews file. DE states that she lost her job and now qualifies for public defender, has information that they are working on an attorney. Court resets STC for attorney status. DE is currently on PO hold. Atty. Schmidt requests bond modification. Court will not address today. Adjourned: 10:43 AM. kma
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Filed by DA, venue amended in charging language. kma

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, David A.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:21 PM CO: SJN, RPR: Deiss, Clerk: Lindabaur. District Attorney Karl Anderson for the State of Wisconsin   Attorney Travis Satorius for Defendant for today. Defendant Melissa Marie Aylward appeared by video, in custody. Atty Satorius states Defendant does not qualify for PD. Defendant doesn't want an atty. Court will address waiver of counsel at next hearing. Court advises of charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. NG pleas. Reserves on pre-plea rights. Bond argument. Court orders bond. DE would like PFAC in the event she wants an atty. Court sets STC to see the status of atty, SETC with DA, and PSC. Adjourned at 1:33 PM.  gll
